pullRequest.title: [#2068] Use cached connected check result in HotrodCache
pullRequest.bodyText:
This fixes #2068:
The HotrodCache#checkForCacheAvailability() method will now determine its outcome based on whether the last cache operation was successful or not. It will only "put" the connectionCheckKey/Value if the last cache operation took place more than 30s ago.
The EmbeddedCache#checkForCacheAvailability() method now only checks whether the cache instance was successfully obtained, not doing the "put" operation with connectionCheckKey/Value anymore.

nodes.bodyText: maybe this method should also be renamed to connectToCache?

IMHO invoking the super class implementation is an anti pattern as you have no control over what is happening there.
FMPOV withCache should be declared final and should be changed to invoke e.g. a postCacheAccess(Handler<AsyncResult<?>>) method with the outcome of the cache access. Subclasses can then override this method or not. But its purpose is well defined in any case ...

commit.message:
[#2068] Used cached connected check result in HotrodCache.

The HotrodCache#checkForCacheAvailability() method will now determine
its outcome based on whether the last cache operation was successful
or not. It will only "put" the connectionCheckKey/Value if the last
cache operation took place more than 30s ago.
The EmbeddedCache#checkForCacheAvailability() method now only checks
whether the cache instance was successfully obtained, not doing the
"put" operation with connectionCheckKey/Value anymore.

Signed-off-by: Carsten Lohmann <carsten.lohmann@bosch.io>
